page.title: 13EMPLOYMENT IN ST. TEATH
page.content: DELABOLE SLATE QUARRY, ABOUT TWO AND A HALF MILES FROM ST. TEATH,. USED TO PROVIDE THE MAIN EMPLOYMENT FOR THE MENFOLK OF THE VILLAGE. NOW THERE ARE VERY FEW JOBS TO BE FOUND LOCALLY FOR THE MALE POPULATION. MOST MEN WORK AS AGRICULTURAL LABOURERS, FOR THE COUNCIL OR SERVICES, OR IN SMALL FACTORIES IN NEARBY TOWNS, OR AS SELF-EMPLOYED TRADESMEN. TWO OLD PEOPLES HOMES, THE VILLAGE SCHOOL, THE WHITE HART INN AND TWO SHOPS PROVIDE SOME EMPLOYMENT FOR THE WOMEN IN THE VILLAGE. OTHERS WORK LOCALLY AS HOME-HELPS OR TRAVEL TO NEIGHBOURING TOWNS TO WORK IN OFFICES. MANY WOMEN TAKE ON SEASONAL EMPLOYMENT IN HOTELS AND RESTAURANTS DURING SUMMER MONTHS. IN COMMON WITH OTHER PARTS OF CORNWALL AT THIS TIME, ST. TEATH HAS A FAIR AMOUNT OF UNEMPLOYED PEOPLE. A LARGE PROPORTION OF RESIDENTS ARE RETIRED .
